intro: Kentrosphaera, commonly known as the spiny sphere, is a unique genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spherical or oval-shaped fruits, which are typically covered in spines or tubercles. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are either male or female, typical of the cucurbit family. Kentrosphaera thrives in warm, tropical climates and is often found in regions with well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
